BAD don't waste your time Review Title: Dumb Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/06/01 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['universal'], 'Producers': ['Mira Nair', 'Robyn Aronstam', 'Caroline Baron', 'Shernaz Italia', 'Caroline Kaplan', 'Freny Khodaiji', 'Jonathan Sehring'], 'Starring': ['Naseeruddin Shah', 'Lillete Dubey'], 'Studio': ['NBC Universal', 'Focus Features']} Review Text: Must watch - v. Heartwarming! Highly recommend it to anyone. It's centered around a wedding and who doesn't love a good party!!! ;) Review Title: Sweet movie Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Layer Cake (Widescreen) Review Date: 2013/07/03 Store: Daniel Craig (Actor), Kenneth Cranham (Actor), Matthew Vaughn (Director) & 0 more Rated: R Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles Product Description: ['Product Description', "Planning to retire and begin a new life, Mr. X (Daniel Craig, Lara Croft: Tomb Raider), a successful West End drug dealer, has been asked for one last favor: to negotiate the sale of one million hitsof Ecstasy. Unfortunately for Mr. X, the pills were stolen from a Serbian drug lord who'll cut offhis head if he sells them. And with a London crime czar (Michael Gambon, Open Range & The Insider)promising to retire him permanently if he doesn't, Mr. X may be rightfully concerned about his future. Nothing worth losing his head over.", 'Amazon.com', 'As its title suggests,', 'Layer Cake', 'is a crime thriller that cuts into several levels of its treacherous criminal underworld. The title is actually one character\'s definition of the drug-trade hierarchy, but it\'s also an apt metaphor for the separate layers of deception, death, and betrayal experienced by the film\'s unnamed protagonist, a cocaine traffic middle-man played with smooth appeal by Daniel Craig (rumored at the time of this film\'s release to be on the short list for consideration as the next James Bond). Listed in the credits only as "XXXX," the character is trapped into doing a favor for his volatile boss, only to have tables turned by his boss\'s boss (Michael Gambon) in a twisting plot involving a stolen shipment of Ecstasy, a missing girl, duplicitous dealers, murderous Serbian gangsters, and a variety of lowlifes with their own deadly agendas. As adapted by J.J. Connolly (from his own novel) and directed by Matthew Vaughan (who earned his genre chops as producer of Guy Ritchie\'s', 'Lock, Stock, and Two Smoking Barrels', 'and', 'Snatch', '),', 'Layer Cake', "improves upon those earlier British gangland hits with assured pacing, intelligent plotting, and an admirable emphasis on plot-moving dialogue over routine action. Sure, it's violent (that's to be expected) and not always involving, but it's smarter than most thrillers, and Vaughan's directorial debut has a confident style that's flashy without being flamboyant. This could be the start of an impressive career.", '--Jeff Shannon'] Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Thriller', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Special Edition, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Ben Davis, Kenneth Cranham, Matthew Ryan, Jason Flemyng, Dragan Micanovic, Don McCorkindale, Francis Magee, Ivan Kaye, Matthew Vaughn, Dexter Fletcher, Louis Emerick, Marcel Iures, Stephen Walters, Dimitri Andreas, Colm Meaney, Steve John Shepherd, Michael Gambon, Darren Healy, Tom Hardy, Ben Whishaw, Benjamin Davis, Daniel Craig, George HarrisBen Davis, Kenneth Cranham, Matthew Ryan, Jason Flemyng, Dragan Micanovic, Don McCorkindale, Francis Magee, Ivan Kaye, Matthew Vaughn, Dexter Fletcher, Louis Emerick, Marcel Iures, Stephen Walters, Dimitri Andreas, Colm Meaney, Steve John Shepherd, Mich… See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), Unqualified', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 45 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'MFR043396108899#VG', 'Director': 'Matthew Vaughn', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Special Edition, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 45 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 23, 2005', 'Actors': 'Daniel Craig, Kenneth Cranham, Dexter Fletcher, Michael Gambon, Colm Meaney', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, French', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Dark comedy

The title is actually one character\'s definition of the drug-trade hierarchy, but it\'s also an apt metaphor for the separate layers of deception, death, and betrayal experienced by the film\'s unnamed protagonist, a cocaine traffic middle-man played with smooth appeal by Daniel Craig (rumored at the time of this film\'s release to be on the short list for consideration as the next James Bond). Connolly (from his own novel) and directed by Matthew Vaughan (who earned his genre chops as producer of Guy Ritchie\'s', 'Lock, Stock, and Two Smoking Barrels', 'and', 'Snatch', '),', 'Layer Cake', "improves upon those earlier British gangland hits with assured pacing, intelligent plotting, and an admirable emphasis on plot-moving dialogue over routine action. Sure, it's violent (that's to be expected) and not always involving, but it's smarter than most thrillers, and Vaughan's directorial debut has a confident style that's flashy without being flamboyant. This could be the start of an impressive career.", '--Jeff Shannon'] Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Thriller', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Special Edition, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Ben Davis, Kenneth Cranham, Matthew Ryan, Jason Flemyng, Dragan Micanovic, Don McCorkindale, Francis Magee, Ivan Kaye, Matthew Vaughn, Dexter Fletcher, Louis Emerick, Marcel Iures, Stephen Walters, Dimitri Andreas, Colm Meaney, Steve John Shepherd, Michael Gambon, Darren Healy, Tom Hardy, Ben Whishaw, Benjamin Davis, Daniel Craig, George HarrisBen Davis, Kenneth Cranham, Matthew Ryan, Jason Flemyng, Dragan Micanovic, Don McCorkindale, Francis Magee, Ivan Kaye, Matthew Vaughn, Dexter Fletcher, Louis Emerick, Marcel Iures, Stephen Walters, Dimitri Andreas, Colm Meaney, Steve John Shepherd, Mich… See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), Unqualified', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 45 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'MFR043396108899#VG', 'Director': 'Matthew Vaughn', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Special Edition, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 45 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 23, 2005', 'Actors': 'Daniel Craig, Kenneth Cranham, Dexter Fletcher, Michael Gambon, Colm Meaney', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, French', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Dark comedy

POSITIVE SUMMARY:
The user has had several enjoyable experiences with movies, particularly those labeled as heartwarming or engaging. They frequently express enthusiasm for films that feature effective storytelling, humor, and appealing characters. Noteworthy sentiments highlight the emotional impact of certain narratives, especially those centered around themes like family and celebration. High ratings often accompany reviews that commend specific films as must-watch or recommendable, indicating a preference for productions that deliver strong entertainment value. The user has also expressed appreciation for the quality of roles played by certain actors, showcasing a recognition of talent that enhances their viewing experience.

NEGATIVE SUMMARY:
Conversely, the user has encountered disappointing experiences, particularly with films deemed lackluster or poorly executed. Specific feedback indicates frustration over time wasted on movies perceived as unintelligent or derivative, with descriptors like "dumb" and "same old" reflecting discontent. Reviews reveal irritation towards films that failed to meet expectations, sometimes resulting in low ratings. Mediocre films are often categorized as time fillers, suggesting dissatisfaction in terms of story quality or character development, reflecting a sharper critique when a film does not resonate positively.

OVERALL SUMMARY:
Overall, the user's purchasing and review history reveals a mixed landscape of experiences. While they celebrate many films for their heartwarming qualities, humor, and strong performances, there are stark criticisms directed at others that fall short, with specific grievances about poor storytelling and wasted viewing time. The contrast of high ratings with negative remarks indicates the user's discerning taste and desire for quality content, inviting a broader exploration into genres that balance engagement with critical storytelling.
